description: Clear rectangular panes with a blue circle at one long side and eight small colored rectangles (blues, orange, green, yellow and swirled green and pink) at opposite long side
text: By the time this window was designed, the Prairie School aesthetic it embodies was fast ceding architectural ground to steel-and-glass modernism and the Colonial Revival style. Set inside a very complex, highly ornamented interior design, the windowâ€™s simple geometric patterns were a dramatic contrast.
title: Window, one of a pair
